title: Electric PE - compare U when particle moved closer

content.question: Two identical particles, each of positive charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, are fixed in place a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> apart. A third particle, also of charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, is initially at rest and located far away from the other two particles, as shown in the figure labeled “Initial Positions.” An external force then moves the third particle until it is at rest a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from the other particles, as shown in the figure labeled “Final Positions.” What is the relation between the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="U sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> of the three-particle system in its initial and final configurations, respectively? What evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub f is greater than U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The external force is exerted in the direction of the third particle’s motion.

<math alttext="U sub f is greater than U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The first two particles exert a net electric force in the direction of the third particle’s motion.

<math alttext="U sub f equals U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The total net charge of the system does not change.

<math alttext="U sub f equals U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The third particle is equidistant from the other two particles initially and finally.

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub f is greater than U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math>. The external force is exerted in the direction of the third particle’s motion.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
